timeline.bodyText: Please add a short description for this class, similar to this example.
timeline.author: thinkingserious

timeline.bodyText: This is duplicated in the SubscribeRule class. Perhaps it's time for a base class.
timeline.author: thinkingserious

replies.bodyText: There are other duplications with the SubscribeRule class that might make sense to refactor too.
replies.author: thinkingserious

timeline.bodyText: Please add a short description here as noted in the RecordingRule class.
timeline.author: thinkingserious

timeline.bodyText: There are many similarities to the SubscribeRulesUpdate.java class. Similar to the SubscribeRule and RecordingRule classes, we can simplify with a base class.
timeline.author: thinkingserious

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand the need for these additional interfaces. And one is returning the type of the other.
timeline.author: childish-sambino

replies.bodyText: They help build rules that make sense - for example, if you have a rule that has "all" or "none" it doesn't make sense to have a kind/publisher/track in the same rule.
replies.author: innerverse

replies.bodyText: Ah, I see the progression now.
replies.author: childish-sambino
